text: I always keep crackers in the house
especially during the holidays for
entertaining or for emergency snacking
now there are lots of good store-bought
crackers on the market today but there's
nothing better than homemade and they're
really much easier to make than you
might think
all you need to start is a cup of flour
teaspoon of coarse salt and 1/2 a
teaspoon of poppy seeds the poppy seeds
give a nice little crunch put it all
together whisk that about to incorporate
it now butter 2 tablespoons unsalted
take it between your fingers and thumbs
and do a sort of rubbing motion you're
creating petals of butter that are
coated in flour and that's going to give
you that nice crispy crunchy cracker
texture after they're baked and cooled
and then this gets the good stuff cheese
two kinds go into these crackers I've
got Gruyere half a cup here and half a
cup of shredded yellow cheddar cheese oh
I've grated way too much but that's ok I
think the rest will be for snacking and
you really just want all of this cheese
to be evenly coated with flour mixture
now for the wet quarter cup of milk and
quarter teaspoon of Dijon I'm gonna add
a little extra Dijon into mine I really
like that flavor okay and again I'm just
using the fork so it gets those
incorporated and this goes into the dry
ingredients so just bring it together
into a dough you might need to knead it
a little bit with your fingers and as
you can see this is all coming together
quite nicely right in the bowl some
plastic wrap and this is going to go
into the freezer for at least an hour
until it's nice and firm or up to three
months our cheddar and Gruyere log is
out of the freezer nice and firm been
about an hour and I also have two other
flavors here that are absolutely
delicious fig and almond and this is a
whole wheat sesame thinly slice these
about an eighth of an inch thick
if you're finding that it's crumbly or
breaking or smashing it's too cold or
too soft and these don't spread much so
you can just they don't need a lot of
space maybe half an inch between
and the sesame sliced the big annulment
okay and these just line up like little
soldiers more poppy seeds for the
cheddar and grier crackers as much or as
little as you'd like
flaky sea salt on the whole-wheat sesame
crackers sea salt is nice because it has
a balance of sweetness against the
saltiness these are ready for the oven
350 degrees for about 15 minutes until
the edges turn golden and they're set on
top our crackers are out of the oven
they're cool and crisp and beautiful
looking and I have a few fun different
topping options to show you here the
first our beautiful little cheddar
Gruyere crackers that we made earlier I
like to keep this really simple just hot
pepper jelly a childhood favorite of
mine
we always had pepper jelly at the
holidays and it just looks really pretty
right on the center of that cracker how
nice is that
and the fig and almond this one I like
to do a little sweet so ricotta cheese a
nice drizzle of honey now you could
certainly do this more savory if you'd
like I think a blue cheese would be
fantastic with the figs and almond and
then for the whole wheat and sesame
Taleggio this is an Italian cheese it's
creamy it has a robust nose but it's
worth it it tastes so good and Taleggio
is wonderful with pears
I have Pharrell pears here it's a
European variety but they're easy to
find here in the States
any pear would be good red on shoe is
really nice you want a sweet juicy
tender pear here to go with this and you
can just make nice little thin slices
here and put these right on top of your
Taleggio and a little black pepper right
on top make a batch of each keep them in
your freezer and you'll be ready to
entertain guests any time
with delicious homemade crackers
